meanings.definition: A bay window, especially one cantilevered or corbelled out from a wall.
meanings.sent1: The oriel in the house provided a cozy nook for reading.
meanings.sent2: The oriel overlooked the garden, letting in plenty of sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The oriel was so small, it felt like a secret hideaway.
meanings.sent4: The oriel jutted out like a welcoming arm from the side of the building.
meanings.sent5: The oriel framed the view outside like a living picture.

meanings.definition: A small room or porch projecting from a building.
meanings.sent1: The oriel was a peaceful spot to enjoy the evening breeze.
meanings.sent2: We gathered in the oriel to watch the sunset together.
meanings.sent3: The oriel was so tiny, it felt like a dollhouse extension.
meanings.sent4: The oriel extended outwards like a miniature balcony.
meanings.sent5: The oriel felt like a cozy alcove in the midst of the bustling city.
